main event: A military observer spotted an unidentified flying object near Plattsburgh Air Force Base, New York on August 20, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed on GCA (Ground Control Approach) radar, indicating it was also detected electronically.
The object maneuvered, moving higher and lower, altering course as it was observed.
The object made high-speed circling turns with a radius of about 1/2 mile and was estimated to be 2-3 miles from the observer.
After circling for about 2 minutes, the object accelerated rapidly to the east at an estimated speed of Mach 1.5.
A separate radar sighting of an isolated, high-intensity jamming phenomenon was also reported in the northwest quadrant of the radar, about 15-20 miles from the base.
sighted object: round, flat, disc-shaped object estimated to be 15-20 feet in diameter
witnesses: military personnel, including a Major with over 4,200 hours of flight experience
